result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott D. Duve was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

timeConds.notes:
--With work-release privileges

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

8/24/15: Based on the Stipulation and Order Extending time to report: The Court orders defendant shall report to the Jefferson County Jail on Friday September 4, 2015 by 4:00 pm

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott D. Duve

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Stipulation and Order Extending time to report: defendant shall report to the Jefferson County Jail on Friday September 4, 2015 by 4:00 pm
Proposed stip to extend time to report

Case called at 9:06am [mo]
Defendant Scott D. Duve in court with Attorney Thomas J Laitsch.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance for both Waiver of Prelim and Plea/Sentencing, notes the victim is present in the gallery

Mr. Duve waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

ADA Hall motions to amend Count #1 to be without all enhancers and modifiers
The Court grants the amendment to Count #1

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1 WITHOUT enhancers and modifiers; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Statement made by victim, Sharon Ludwig

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Duve

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 9 months, with conditions:

--to serve 20 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on    8/28 /15 at 4:00pm.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars or taverns
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay Court appointed attorney fees

The Court determines that Mr. Duve has previously submitted a DNA sample and therefore does not order Mr. Duve to do so in this case
Days credit for time already served:  1  day
recess:9:43am
Order for payment of attorney fees of $126
Conflict Review Worksheet - No Conflict Found

Case called at 10:05am [mo]
Defendant Scott D. Duve in court with Attorney Thomas J Laitsch.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance.

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute/DA Wambach did prosecute Mr. Duve. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Atty. Laitsch indicates that an offer was extended by the State, further he indicates that Mr. Duve is neither accepting nor decling the offer, simply needs additional time to consider the offer.
The Court directs the Clerk to schedule a Preliminary Hearing, which can become a Plea & Sentencing if necessary.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 10:10am 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing(likely Plea/Sent.): 8/17/2015 at 9:00am
Petition for payment of attorney fees
Consent to Act endorses by Atty Laitsch (with cover letter)
The Court appoints Attorney Laitsch//repayment order of $30 a month starting 07-22-15

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 11:08am. 
Defendant Scott D. Duve in court.  ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court continues the $150 Cash Bond, with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence toward anyone
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Sharon Ludwig 
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol 
--no presence in bars, taverns, package houses 
- the Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  The Defendant is to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse today at 1:30pm.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
recess 11:14am

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/1/15 at 10:00am  (2) Status Conference on 7/21/15 at 10:00am
